Title: Attribution Analyst (Cortex Xpanse)
RoleDescription:
Your CareerIn this role, you will primarily focus on asset attribution (the process of attributing ownership of assets to an organization). Each analyst is responsible for fully identifying and assessing an organizations attack surface. Attack surface refers to all possible internet-facing access points that a malicious actor can use to compromise a companys system. Using various internal and external research techniques, attribution analysts determine which internet-facing assets belong to a company of interest by investigating the registration information of those assets, including domains, certificates, and IP networks. The analysts focus on a specific company's profile (geographical location, company structure, company naming conventions, historical information, etc.) to narrow a broad scope of probable assets to those linked to the company of interest. A process we refer to as "attack surface discovery."This is an ideal role for individuals (without a cybersecurity background) seeking to break into cybersecurity. If you have an analytical mind, an aptitude for technically minded work, and an interest in working in cyber, this is for you!Your ImpactPerform attack surface discovery on client internet-facing networks, thoroughly investigating thousands of possible assets and making informed ownership decisions.Partner with sales and customer success to answer technical client questions and help explain and demonstrate the software's use cases to prospects/customers.Partner closely with product and engineering teams to refine our attack surface discovery toolset.Review of technical documentation for training materials, technical marketing collateral, manuals, troubleshooting guides, etc.Participation in on-call duty.Your Experience Bachelors degree in Statistics, Finance, Math, or another technical discipline focused on problem-solving analysis.2-4 years of working experience.Conceptual understanding of technical topics (e.g., mathematical concepts).Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Strong time management and prioritization skills.Results-driven and thrives in a fast-paced environment.Strong ability to operate with autonomy and independence in a remote setting.[preferred] Client-facing expertise within sales or customer success.[preferred] Experience with spreadsheet applications, like MS Excel or Google Sheets (specifically using more advanced features like macros, pivot tables, and v-lookups).The TeamAs part of the Cortex organization, Xpanse protects the worlds most important organizations by discovering risks on the Internet no one else can find. Xpanse helps the worlds largest enterprises discover their attack surface and mitigate cyber risks. Our transformative technology is redefining the way that Fortune 500s view, measure, and invest in Internet safety.Compensation DisclosureThe compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location.
